    Generating Multivariate Normal Data Using the Cholesky Decomposition

    Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

    rmvn_chol.Rmd
    library(multiNorm)

    The multivariate normal distribution is given by

    \[\begin{equation} \mathcal{N} \left( \boldsymbol{\mu}, \boldsymbol{\Sigma} \right) \label{eq:mvn} \end{equation}\]

    where \(\boldsymbol{\mu}\) is a \(k \times 1\) vector of means, and \(\boldsymbol{\Sigma}\) is a \(k \times k\) matrix of variances on the diagonals and covariances on the off-diagonals.

    Multivariate normal data can be generated using

    \[\begin{equation} \mathbf{Z} \mathbf{Q} + 1_n \boldsymbol{\mu} \label{eq:rmvn-chol} \end{equation}\]

    where \(\mathbf{Z}\) is an \(n \times k\) matrix of random variates from the standard normal distribution, \(\mathbf{Q}\) is the upper triangular factor of the Cholesky decomposition given by \(\boldsymbol{\Sigma} = \mathbf{Q}^{\prime} \mathbf{Q}\) where \(\boldsymbol{\Sigma}\) is the covariance matrix, \(1_n\) is an \(n \times 1\) column vector of ones, and \(\boldsymbol{\mu}\) is the mean vector.

    set.seed(42)
n_i <- 1000000
k_i <- sample(x = 2:10, size = 1)
mu_i <- rep(x = 0, times = k_i)
rho_i <- runif(n = 1, min = -1, max = 1)
sigmacap_i <- matrix(
  data = rho_i,
  nrow = k_i,
  ncol = k_i
)
diag(sigmacap_i) <- 1
vech_i <- vech(sigmacap_i)
rhocap_i <- cov2cor(sigmacap_i)
vechs_i <- vechs(rhocap_i)
mu_i
#> [1] 0 0
sigmacap_i
#>           [,1]      [,2]
#> [1,] 1.0000000 0.8741508
#> [2,] 0.8741508 1.0000000
vech_i
#> [1] 1.0000000 0.8741508 1.0000000
rhocap_i
#>           [,1]      [,2]
#> [1,] 1.0000000 0.8741508
#> [2,] 0.8741508 1.0000000
vechs_i
#> [1] 0.8741508

    rmvn_chol

    data_i <- rmvn_chol(
  n = n_i,
  mu = mu_i,
  sigmacap = sigmacap_i
)
colMeans(data_i)
#> [1] 0.0005710992 0.0002364086
cov(data_i)
#>           [,1]      [,2]
#> [1,] 1.0020690 0.8757114
#> [2,] 0.8757114 1.0010073

    rmvn_theta

    theta_i <- c(
  mu_i,
  vech(sigmacap_i)
)
data_i <- rmvn_chol_of_theta(
  n = n_i,
  x = theta_i
)
colMeans(data_i)
#> [1] 0.0010693024 0.0005817952
cov(data_i)
#>           [,1]      [,2]
#> [1,] 0.9992231 0.8737345
#> [2,] 0.8737345 0.9998715

    rmvn_chol_of_rhocap

    data_i <- rmvn_chol_of_rhocap(
  n = n_i,
  x = rhocap_i
)
colMeans(data_i)
#> [1] 0.001783648 0.001572559
cov(data_i)
#>           [,1]      [,2]
#> [1,] 0.9994832 0.8730244
#> [2,] 0.8730244 0.9987102

    rmvn_chol_of_vechsrhocap

    data_i <- rmvn_chol_of_vechsrhocap(
  n = n_i,
  x = vechs_i
)
colMeans(data_i)
#> [1] 0.001489872 0.001378077
cov(data_i)
#>           [,1]      [,2]
#> [1,] 1.0012744 0.8756157
#> [2,] 0.8756157 1.0016384
